title: Fix Shadcn Select crash caused by empty SelectItem values in product/admin pages

requirements.text: Fix the runtime crash "A <Select.Item /> must have a value prop that is not an empty string" by removing/replacing any <SelectItem value=""> usage in the product catalog filters and ensuring the UI still supports an "All"/"no filter" state without using an empty string SelectItem value.

quotes: Error: A <Select.Item /> must have a value prop that is not an empty string...

acceptanceCriteria: Visiting the Product Catalog page no longer throws the Select.Item empty-string runtime error.
Category filter supports an "All Categories" option without using an empty string SelectItem value.
Usage filter supports an "All" option without using an empty string SelectItem value.
Clearing a filter results in the intended unfiltered state in the product grid.

requirements.text: Audit the admin products page and any other product-related pages/components that render Shadcn <SelectItem /> options, and ensure no <SelectItem /> is rendered with an empty-string value (including dynamically-generated items where the underlying value might be ''). Add guards so that empty/invalid option values are filtered out or mapped to a non-empty sentinel value.

quotes: Error: A <Select.Item /> must have a value prop that is not an empty string...

acceptanceCriteria: Admin Products page loads without triggering the Select.Item empty-string runtime error.
No Select dropdown in admin/product flows renders an item whose value prop is an empty string.
If backend/category data contains empty-string names, they are not rendered as SelectItems and do not crash the page.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only UI component sources must be composed, not edited).
Keep all user-facing text in English.
nonGoals: No backend schema changes or migrations for this fix.
No redesign of the product/admin UX beyond what is required to resolve the Select crash and restore functionality.
